title: How can we say that we are human beings? - Quora

response.answer_text: The intelligent mind separates human from other species which is so evident and simple. This mind many times take human in much lower ladder from animals or other species. Other species keep following to live in nature and maintain harmony with nature. The nature is summation of lives or any living species and includes other life component like, vegetation, water, environment, earth and every natural resources. The greatest quality of human be humanity but presently we generally are quite far from such spirit as on the present state of evolution. We live in selfish world and find satisfaction within our known set of people or community or nationality and so on but this equation is changing rapidly with expansion of technology and global connectivity for economical reason at personal level and national level. Yet one thing that makes human is the knowledge of immortal spirit we possess within and same is present in every other human and the spirit in its pure form has same quality. So it is love and compassion we have in nature tries to see all equal; Giving due respect and humility enables to build mutual trust and so Ethical way of living is always spreading fragrance the feeling of HUMANITY.

Humans are different from all other beings due to consciousness. We percieve our existence. It means that we know about our existence. Unlike other beings who don’t have consciousness. We know past and determine future on the base of observations, we did in past or doing in present. We think logically because we have reason but other beings don’t have any logical thoughts. We have a priori as well as aposteriori knowledge but other beings can’t conclude from logical premises, because it need reason to check whether the premises are correct or not. We are trying to understand the Universe and govern it and this credit goes to our reason. We feel subjective things like beauty and we also believe in morality. Religion defines our ethics and morality, that how we ought to act in a society, and besides religion, Philosphers also tried to eastiblish ethics for harmony society. For other beings there is no morality and ethics. Perhaps they have some apriori knowledge for their survival but they don’t know the a posteriori knowledge and perhaps for they feel the emotion but not the beauty, the aesthetic pleasures. That’s why we are human. Our reason and cinsciousness make us human.

Our ability to make a conscious choice, to set a standard, and be able to justify it, is what separates human beings from other animals. Many higher animals do show compassion, so the suggestions I've seen in other answers don't seem completely right to me. But what separates us, is a consciousness, the ability to be aware of what one is doing, and to adjudge whether it is correct or not, yet still choose to continue doing what we believe is wrong. This last point, the dilution of standards, and refusal to recognise when something is wrong, is what is leading the world into chaos, and is what is destroying humanity. We have the power of will, though I don't mean sacrifice, for even a mother dog will starve herself for her puppies. But we can choose to ruin our lives, to succeed, whatever. It is entirely upto is how we choose to make our lives and in which direction we go, while being fully aware of the choices we make. This self-awareness, the ability to know, is what makes us human.

Certain basic distinctive characteristic help us to qualify to the supreme degree of HUMAN BEINGS.  Firstly, there are some common characteristics that we share with other living organisms but they do help us in qualifying for the basic post of human beings.  7 of them are listed below. I urge that exceptions such as handicapped people must be ignored in these 7 points.   Movement - Known as the displacement of an organism from one place to another. We can move,run,jump and do all sorts of stupendous tasks with the help our legs. Respiration - Known to be the basic essentiality, it is the process by which we breakdown glucose to obtain valuable energy. Sensitivity - We are able to detect changes in the surroundings and respond to them. Growth - The permanent increase in one's size upto a certain age. Reproduction - Ability of an organism to produce offsprings of the same kind. Excretion - Removal of metabolic toxic waste products and products which are in excess. Nutrition - Taking in nutrients from the environment to feed onself in order to provide energy.  Apart from this, SOCIAL BEHAVIORAL SKILLS,  TASK MANAGING SKILLS,  COMPUTING SKILLS,  EMOTIONAL DEVELOPMENT, EFFICIENCY TO USE OUR BRAIN EFFECTIVELY and OUR CRITICAL AND LOGICAL THINKING CAPABILITIES make us different from other living beings.  The so called community is therefore known as HUMAN BEINGS for the vast use of our brain that we have done on day to day basis in order to improve and make our lives easy.  Consider another point here, were the early humans as advanced as the present ones? The answer is certainly a NO. We didn't have enough thinking capabilities to make use of our surroundings at that time. As time gradually passed, humans have advanced a lot. This is evident in today's world.  In one line to answer this tricky question, I would say that HUMANS ARE PROBABLY THE ONLY BEINGS WHO HAVE ATTACHED A MATERIALISTIC VALUE TO EVERYTHING.  And yes! That makes us different! Absolutely different!

I have control over and a metacognitive knowledge of my limbic system that isn’t strictly identified with it (I don’t think purely with my feelings, I balance all feelings with a self-consistent framework of thought and can prioritize some over others instead of the strongest winning by default) I have empathy, foresight, the capacity for generativity, metacognition, planning and abstraction. I am capable of thinking in abstract systems and have some good deal of control over my future via my will when in a healthy, sane environment. I have a good sense of temporal balance and a good sense of interpersonal reciprocity. I am capable of deep and environment-flexible learning, and meaning and art are important to me.

You just say it… “I’m a Human Being” In whatever language you care to. Otherwise the point is moot, it’s human’s that are inventing a name for itself, Think of it this way. What was the first word ever used by a Human. All words in all the worlds State Libraries i.e. US Library of congress, it has to be uttered THE FIRST TIME EVER IN THE HISTORY OF THE UNIVERSE. And whoever said Human for a Human the first time ever, stuck and it’s in the dictionary. That guy could have said Goerge or Ralph, instead. But then probably a lot of the scientific names for sub and parent would be different using that logic that used Human instead of George as a species name for Human. Classification Level Scientific Name Kingdom Animalia Subkingdom Invertebrate Phylum Arthropoda Class Insecta Order Lepidoptera Family Danaidae Genus Dannaus Species Plexippus Common Name Monarch Butterfly Scientific Name Dannaus plexippus Read more: How Are Animals Classified?

Well, that's what everyone thinks. When I go outside, people on the sidewalk pass me and I can almost hear them think, "Yup, there's another human." I walk into a store to buy something and the guy at the cash register doesn't ask for human ID. He just wants to know what I want to buy. Only humans want to buy stuff, right? If I came in and just stood there, he'd have a problem. He'd have to call somebody, maybe the manager or security. I'd be escorted out. "Sorry, you can't be here. Only humans allowed." But I'm not, so I must be human. You've made me curious, so I just asked my wife if I'm human. She gave me her "What the hell are you on about now?" look and said, "Yup, as far as I know. What are you doing, horsing around on Quora again?" I told her no, nothing of the kind, I'm doing important research online. She said, "Oh, right." But just between you and me, sometimes Quora makes me question my very existence. Never mind am I human. Do I even exist? Do you? What the hell is this, some kind of skit? I have to go to the bathroom. That's something a human might do, yes? I rest my case. Thanks for the A2A.

The one thing that makes us all human beings I think, is the ability to empathise. Doesn't matter in whatever position you are in, how much you earn, if you can't feel the pain of a creature at front, a lame dog, a hungry person asking for a morsel of food, a small kid sweeping the floor in a train, asking for a penny or even just a stranger who doesn't seem in a good mood, you can never be entitled to be a human being. Buddha was the epitome of true compassion. He did not have to experience all the realities of life himself to get into the path of vairagya. Seeing other's suffering he used to feel so much pain, that he vowed to find an end to all this, left all the relationships, oppulency behind and walk on the path of soul search. Compassion is at the core of spirituality. Unless you are able to see the same source in every living being around, realising it within which is the sole purpose of every human life, is next to impossible.

First of all, I think the use of word “human” needs to be seen from two perspectives - first as common noun and second as adjective. As a common noun, I think humans are no different from other species - rodents, apes, cats, etc - anatomical changes notwithstanding, as no two species are supposed to be similar and hence these differences are not what you can say the real differences. The adjective 'human' is also not very different from other species. How can we claim that only humans have love and compassion without getting into the skin of other animals? There are umpteen examples of presence of emotions in animals, some of which we keep watching on TV or read in newspapers. So I think even these emotions are not clear differentiating factors - though one can always debate on level of emotional feeling we humans exhibit. As per my understanding, the only difference, I could think of is the ability to use brain ( and not just presence of brain). Animals have brain and use it to survive. Humans certainly have superior level of brain, and use this not just to survive, but also to grow and develop. Or else we could have just lived in caves till now. Animals have also developed, but these changes are more evolutionary and not human-like - from caves to skyscrapers, from feet to aircrafts, and many more.

The first thing that comes in my mind what is the meaning of Human. Everybody has their own meaning according to situation that makes them human. The area of being a human has increased now. When you respect your elders & younger ones from bottom of your heart, you are Human. When you respect girls & women, you are Human. When you help the person with all your efforts without expecting the same in return, you are Human. When you use our nature resources wisely, you are the Human. When you keep your surrounding neat and clean, you are Human. When your efforts make positive difference in the society, you are Human. When you start believing in “ Forgive & Forget”, you are Human. A well dressed and strong person can be a Man but not a Human. I don’t know who all are true Human on this earth but one thing that I know “Insaan ban jao, Bahut scope hai.” “Save Human” Happy Reading!!! Thanks, Ankur

If we examine the fundamental activities of life, it can be easily seen that, we have no innate knack, though all other forms of life, have plenty. We need external assistance, or monitoring, or both, even for one of the most basic functions of a species, procreation. And when it comes to the ‘trade mark’ function of humans, thinking, any letup in supervisory or overseeing, or other types of control will be felt immediately as irreppairable damage, or grave error, that too, costly to the future of the species itself. So what makes one a human being? The dire need, to learn, and the natural skill, for that.

Now many people will want to quibble about the characteristics that "should" go in to being human.... That a human should be this and that and the other thing and that if the individual is not then they are something less than human.... But that's a different question entirely.

A human being is a combination of identities that come from Time and space and the identity that belongs to eternal. The vocation of Time is to become a vehicle of eternity or divine. It is to manifest attributes of divine like love and compassion, in relationship. It is this possibility that makes human beings human.
